intro: Valeriana remota, commonly known as the remote valerian, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in harsh, cold climates. Valeriana remota is valued for its medicinal properties, though it is less commonly cultivated than other valerian species.
